page.title: 15Martello Towers, Pevensey
page.content: There are 4 Martello Towers standing along the beach at Pevensey Bay.Towers were built every 500 yards(twice the range of the cannon set on the top of each).They were for{protection against {Napoleonic}invasion.Many have been demolished.Each tower is circular with a central pillar to support the rotating cannon.On the sea side the walls are 5m thick and on the landward side 4m.They are built with over 1million bricks,the mortar was mixed with sand from the beach.One tower will be incorporated into the{proposed {Eastbourne Marina}development.One is a private dwelling and the other 2 are being converted to{private homes.}They are{listed as ancient monuments,}which means they must not be altered externally.One of these towers has a legacy from World War 2,Canadian soldiers put a gun emplacement on top.
